00077 struct attack_start_args
00078 {
00079   struct arglist *globals;

00099 static void
00100 fork_sleep (int n)
00101 {
00102   time_t then, now;
00103 
00104   now = then = time (NULL);
00105   while (now - then < n)
00106     {
00107       waitpid (-1, NULL, WNOHANG);
00108       usleep (10000);
00109       now = time (NULL);
00110     }
00111 }
00112 
00116 static void
00117 attack_handle_sigusr1 ()
00118 {
00119   pause_whole_test = 1;
00120 }
00121 
00125 static void
00126 attack_handle_sigusr2 ()
00127 {
00128   pause_whole_test = 0;
00129 }

00148 static struct arglist *
00149 attack_init_hostinfos_vhosts (char *mac, char *hostname, struct in6_addr *ip,
00150                               char *vhosts, char *fqdn)
00151 {
00152   struct arglist *hostinfos;
00153 
00154   hostinfos = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00155   if (mac)
00156     {
00157       arg_add_value (hostinfos, "NAME", ARG_STRING, strlen (mac), mac);
00158       arg_add_value (hostinfos, "MAC", ARG_STRING, strlen (mac), mac);
00159     }
00160   else
00161     arg_add_value (hostinfos, "NAME", ARG_STRING, strlen (hostname),
00162                    estrdup (hostname));
00163 
00164   if (fqdn)
00165     arg_add_value (hostinfos, "FQDN", ARG_STRING, strlen (fqdn),
00166                    estrdup (fqdn));
00167   arg_add_value (hostinfos, "IP", ARG_PTR, sizeof (struct in6_addr), ip);
00168   if (vhosts)
00169     arg_add_value (hostinfos, "VHOSTS", ARG_STRING, strlen (vhosts),
00170                    estrdup (vhosts));
00171   return (hostinfos);
00172 }
00173 
00189 static struct arglist *
00190 attack_init_hostinfos (char *mac, char *hostname, struct in6_addr *ip,
00191                        char *fqdn)
00192 {
00193   struct arglist *hostinfos;
00194 
00195   hostinfos = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00196   if (mac)
00197     {
00198       arg_add_value (hostinfos, "NAME", ARG_STRING, strlen (mac), mac);
00199       arg_add_value (hostinfos, "MAC", ARG_STRING, strlen (mac), mac);
00200     }
00201   else
00202     arg_add_value (hostinfos, "NAME", ARG_STRING, strlen (hostname),
00203                    estrdup (hostname));
00204   if (fqdn)
00205     arg_add_value (hostinfos, "FQDN", ARG_STRING, strlen (fqdn),
00206                    estrdup (fqdn));
00207 
00208   arg_add_value (hostinfos, "IP", ARG_PTR, sizeof (struct in6_addr), ip);
00209   return (hostinfos);
00210 }
00211 
00223 static int
00224 launch_plugin (struct arglist *globals, plugins_scheduler_t * sched,
00225                struct scheduler_plugin *plugin, char *hostname, int *cur_plug,
00226                int num_plugs, struct arglist *hostinfos, kb_t kb,
00227                gboolean new_kb)
00228 {
00229   struct arglist *preferences = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00230   struct arglist *args = plugin->arglist->value;
00231   nvticache_t *nvticache = (nvticache_t *)arg_get_value (
00232     arg_get_value (args, "preferences"), "nvticache");
00233   char name[1024], oid_[100], *oid, *src;
00234   int optimize = preferences_optimize_test (preferences);
00235   int category = plugin->category;
00236   gchar *network_scan_status;
00237   gboolean network_scan = FALSE;
00238 
00239   oid = arg_get_value (args, "OID");
00240   if (oid)
00241     src = nvticache_get_src_by_oid (nvticache, oid);
00242   else
00243     return 0;
00244 
00245   strncpy (name, src, sizeof (name) - 1);
00246   name[sizeof (name) - 1] = '\0';
00247   g_free (src);
00248 
00249   // we need the oid later on and have many exits, so better
00250   // store it locally without need to free it.
00251   strncpy (oid_, oid, sizeof (oid_) - 1);
00252   oid_[sizeof (oid_) - 1] = '\0';
00253 
00254   network_scan_status = arg_get_value (globals, "network_scan_status");
00255   if (network_scan_status != NULL)
00256     if (g_ascii_strcasecmp (network_scan_status, "busy") == 0)
00257       network_scan = TRUE;
00258 
00259   if (plug_get_launch (args) != LAUNCH_DISABLED || category == ACT_SETTINGS)    /* can we launch it ? */
00260     {
00261       char *error;
00262       static int last_status = 0;
00263 
00264       if (preferences_safe_checks_enabled (preferences)
00265           && (category == ACT_DESTRUCTIVE_ATTACK || category == ACT_KILL_HOST
00266               || category == ACT_FLOOD || category == ACT_DENIAL))
00267         {
00268           if (preferences_log_whole_attack (preferences))
00269             log_write
00270               ("Not launching %s against %s %s (this is not an error)\n",
00271                plugin->arglist->name, hostname,
00272                "because safe checks are enabled");
00273           plugin_set_running_state (plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00274           return 0;
00275         }
00276 
00277       (*cur_plug)++;
00278       if ((*cur_plug * 100) / num_plugs >= last_status)
00279         {
00280           last_status = (*cur_plug * 100) / num_plugs + 2;
00281           if (comm_send_status
00282               (globals, hostname, "attack", *cur_plug, num_plugs) < 0)
00283             {
00284               /* Could not send our status back to our father -> exit */
00285               pluginlaunch_stop ();
00286               return ERR_HOST_DEAD;
00287             }
00288         }
00289 
00290       if (network_scan)
00291         {
00292           char asc_id[100];
00293 
00294           snprintf (asc_id, sizeof (asc_id), "Launched/%s", oid);
00295 
00296           if (kb_item_get_int (kb, asc_id) > 0)
00297             {
00298               if (preferences_log_whole_attack (preferences))
00299                 log_write
00300                   ("Not launching %s against %s %s (this is not an error)\n",
00301                    plugin->arglist->name, hostname,
00302                    "because it has already been launched in the past");
00303               plugin_set_running_state (plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00304               return 0;
00305             }
00306           else
00307             {
00308               kb_item_add_int (kb, asc_id, 1);
00309               save_kb_write_int (globals, "network", asc_id, 1);
00310             }
00311         }
00312 
00313       /* Do not launch NVT if mandatory key is missing (e.g. an important tool
00314        * was not found). This is ignored during network wide scanning phases. */
00315       if (network_scan || mandatory_requirements_met (kb, plugin))
00316         error = NULL;
00317       else
00318         error = "because a mandatory key is missing";
00319 
00320       if (!error
00321           && (!optimize
00322               || !(error = requirements_plugin (kb, plugin, preferences))))
00323         {
00324           int pid;
00325 
00326           /* Start the plugin */
00327           pid =
00328             plugin_launch (globals, sched, plugin, hostinfos, preferences, kb,
00329                            name);
00330           if (pid < 0)
00331             {
00332               plugin_set_running_state (plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_UNRUN);
00333               return ERR_CANT_FORK;
00334             }
00335 
00336           if (preferences_log_whole_attack (preferences))
00337             log_write ("Launching %s against %s [%d]\n",
00338                        plugin->arglist->name, hostname, pid);
00339 
00340           /* Stop the test if the host is 'dead' */
00341           if (kb_item_get_int (kb, "Host/dead") > 0
00342               || kb_item_get_int (kb, "Host/ping_failed") > 0)
00343             {
00344               log_write ("The remote host (%s) is dead\n", hostname);
00345               pluginlaunch_stop ();
00346 
00347               if (new_kb == TRUE)
00348                 save_kb_close (globals, hostname);
00349 
00350               if (kb_item_get_int (kb, "Host/ping_failed") > 0)
00351                 save_kb_restore_backup (hostname);
00352 
00353               plugin_set_running_state (plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00354               return ERR_HOST_DEAD;
00355             }
00356         }
00357       else                      /* requirements_plugin() failed */
00358         {
00359           plugin_set_running_state (plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00360           if (preferences_log_whole_attack (preferences))
00361             log_write
00362               ("Not launching %s against %s %s (this is not an error)\n",
00363                plugin->arglist->name, hostname,
00364                error);
00365         }
00366     }                           /* if(plugins->launch) */
00367   else
00368     plugin_set_running_state (plugin, PLUGIN_STATUS_DONE);
00369 
00370   return 0;
00371 }
00372 
00381 static gboolean
00382 is_pattern (const char *str)
00383 {
00384   // NOTE This function was copied from openvas-client/nvt_pref_sshlogin.c
00385   return (str != NULL
00386           && (strchr (str, '*') != NULL || strchr (str, '?') != NULL));
00387 }
00388 
00400 static gboolean
00401 pattern_matches (char *key_pattern, char *value_login, char *hostname)
00402 {
00403 #ifndef NDEBUG
00404   printf ("SSH-DEBUG: Testing if %s is pattern\n", key_pattern);
00405 #endif
00406   if (is_pattern (key_pattern) == FALSE)
00407     return FALSE;
00408 
00409 #ifndef NDEBUG
00410   printf ("SSH-DEBUG: Testing Pattern %s against %s\n", key_pattern, hostname);
00411 #endif
00412   if (g_pattern_match_simple (key_pattern, hostname) == TRUE)
00413     return TRUE;
00414 
00415   return FALSE;
00416 }
00417 
00430 static void
00431 fill_host_kb_ssh_credentials (kb_t kb, struct arglist *globals,
00432                               char *hostname)
00433 {
00434   GHashTable *map_host_login_names = NULL;
00435   GHashTable *map_loginname_login = NULL;
00436   GHashTable *file_translation = NULL;
00437   char *accountname = NULL;
00438   openvas_ssh_login *login = NULL;
00439 
00440   map_host_login_names = arg_get_value (globals, "MAP_HOST_SSHLOGIN_NAME");
00441   map_loginname_login = arg_get_value (globals, "MAP_NAME_SSHLOGIN");
00442 
00443   if (map_host_login_names == NULL || map_loginname_login == NULL)
00444     {
00445 #ifndef NDEBUG
00446       printf
00447         ("SSH-DEBUG: Host %s: no extended credentials configuration.\n",
00448          hostname);
00449 #endif
00450       return;
00451     }
00452 
00453   // Look up the user assigned name for the login assigned explicitely to this host.
00454   accountname = g_hash_table_lookup (map_host_login_names, hostname);
00455 
00456   // Try to fetch login struct
00457   if (accountname != NULL)
00458     login = g_hash_table_lookup (map_loginname_login, accountname);
00459 
00460   // No login- account name for this host found? Seach if any pattern matches.
00461   if (accountname == NULL || login == NULL)
00462     {
00463 #ifndef NDEBUG
00464       printf ("SSH-DEBUG: Trying to match patterns for login at %s\n",
00465               hostname);
00466 #endif
00467       accountname =
00468         g_hash_table_find (map_host_login_names, (GHRFunc) pattern_matches,
00469                            hostname);
00470       // Try to fetch login struct
00471       if (accountname != NULL)
00472         login = g_hash_table_lookup (map_loginname_login, accountname);
00473     }
00474 
00475   // No pattern matching this host found? Try "Default".
00476   if (accountname == NULL || login == NULL)
00477     {
00478 #ifndef NDEBUG
00479       printf ("SSH-DEBUG: Trying Default- account for local checks at %s\n",
00480               hostname);
00481 #endif
00482       accountname = g_hash_table_lookup (map_host_login_names, "Default");
00483 
00484       // If none under 'Default' either, done.
00485       if (accountname == NULL)
00486         {
00487 #ifndef NDEBUG
00488           printf
00489             ("SSH-DEBUG: Not setting login information for local checks at %s: No even Default account found.\n",
00490              hostname);
00491 #endif
00492           return;
00493         }
00494       else
00495         {
00496           login = g_hash_table_lookup (map_loginname_login, accountname);
00497           // No login information for this login-account found? Strange, but so be it.
00498           if (login == NULL)
00499             {
00500 #ifndef NDEBUG
00501               printf
00502                 ("SSH-DEBUG: Could not find info for accountname '%s' for local checks at %s.\n",
00503                  accountname, hostname);
00504 #endif
00505               return;
00506             }
00507         }
00508     }
00509 
00510 #ifndef NDEBUG
00511   printf
00512     ("SSH-DEBUG: Resolving infos of account '%s' for local checks at %s.\n",
00513      accountname, hostname);
00514 #endif
00515 
00516   // Get the translation table (remotefilepath -> localfilepath)
00517   file_translation = arg_get_value (globals, "files_translation");
00518   if (file_translation == NULL)
00519     return;
00520 
00521   // Fill knowledge base with host specific login information
00522   if (login->username)
00523     kb_item_set_str (kb, "Secret/SSH/login", login->username);
00524 
00525   if (login->userpassword)
00526     kb_item_set_str (kb, "Secret/SSH/password", login->userpassword);
00527 
00528   if (login->ssh_key_passphrase)
00529     kb_item_set_str (kb, "Secret/SSH/passphrase", login->ssh_key_passphrase);
00530 
00531   // For the key-files: look up content uploaded by client and set in kb
00532   if (login->public_key_path)
00533     {
00534       char *contents = g_hash_table_lookup (file_translation,
00535                                             login->public_key_path);
00536       if (contents)
00537         {
00538           kb_item_set_str (kb, "Secret/SSH/publickey", contents);
00539         }
00540     }
00541   if (login->private_key_path)
00542     {
00543       char *contents = g_hash_table_lookup (file_translation,
00544                                             login->private_key_path);
00545       if (contents)
00546         {
00547           kb_item_set_str (kb, "Secret/SSH/privatekey", contents);
00548         }
00549     }
00550 
00551 #ifndef NDEBUG
00552   printf ("SSH-DEBUG: Resolved account name %s for local tests at %s\n",
00553           accountname, hostname);
00554 #endif
00555 }
00556 
00557 // TODO eventually to be moved to libopenvas kb.c
00572 static kb_t
00573 init_host_kb (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname,
00574               struct arglist *hostinfos, gboolean * new_kb)
00575 {
00576   kb_t kb, network_kb;
00577   (*new_kb) = FALSE;
00578   gchar *vhosts;
00579   struct kb_item *host_network_results = NULL;
00580   struct kb_item *result_iter;
00581 
00582   gchar *network_scan_status = (gchar *) arg_get_value (globals, "network_scan_status");
00583   if (network_scan_status != NULL)
00584     {
00585       if (g_ascii_strcasecmp (network_scan_status, "done") == 0)
00586         {
00587           gchar *hostname_pattern = g_strdup_printf ("%s/*", hostname);
00588           network_kb = save_kb_load_kb (globals, "network");
00589           host_network_results = kb_item_get_pattern (network_kb, hostname_pattern);
00590         }
00591       if (g_ascii_strcasecmp (network_scan_status, "busy") == 0)
00592         {
00593           arg_add_value (globals, "CURRENTLY_TESTED_HOST", ARG_STRING,
00594                          strlen ("network"), "network");
00595           save_kb_new (globals, "network");
00596           kb = kb_new ();
00597           (*new_kb) = TRUE;
00598           return kb;
00599         }
00600     }
00601 
00602   // Check if kb should be saved.
00603   if (save_kb (globals))
00604     {
00605       // Check if a saved kb exists and we shall restore it.
00606       if (save_kb_exists (hostname) != 0)
00607         {
00608           save_kb_backup (hostname);
00609           kb = save_kb_load_kb (globals, hostname);
00610         }
00611       else
00612         {
00613           // We shall not or cannot restore.
00614           save_kb_new (globals, hostname);
00615           kb = kb_new ();
00616           (*new_kb) = TRUE;
00617         }
00618  
00619       arg_add_value (globals, "CURRENTLY_TESTED_HOST", ARG_STRING,
00620                      strlen (hostname), hostname);
00621     }
00622   else                          /* save_kb(globals) */
00623     {
00624       kb = kb_new ();
00625     }
00626 
00627   /* Add local check (SSH)- related knowledge base items. */
00628   fill_host_kb_ssh_credentials (kb, globals, hostname);
00629 
00630   /* If vhosts is set, split it and put it in the KB. */
00631   vhosts = (gchar *)arg_get_value (hostinfos, "VHOSTS");
00632   if (vhosts)
00633     {
00634       gchar **vhosts_array = g_strsplit (vhosts, ",", 0);
00635       guint i = 0;
00636       while (vhosts_array[i] != NULL)
00637         {
00638           kb_item_add_str (kb, "hostinfos/vhosts", vhosts_array[i]);
00639           save_kb_write_str (globals, hostname, "hostinfos/vhosts", vhosts_array[i]);
00640           i++;
00641         }
00642       g_strfreev (vhosts_array);
00643     }
00644 
00645   result_iter = host_network_results;
00646   while (result_iter != NULL)
00647     {
00648       char *newname = strstr (result_iter->name, "/") + 1;
00649       if (result_iter->type == KB_TYPE_STR)
00650         {
00651           kb_item_add_str (kb, newname, result_iter->v.v_str);
00652           save_kb_write_str (globals, hostname, newname, result_iter->v.v_str);
00653         }
00654       else if (result_iter->type == KB_TYPE_INT)
00655         {
00656           kb_item_add_int (kb, newname, result_iter->v.v_int);
00657           save_kb_write_int (globals, hostname, newname, result_iter->v.v_int);
00658         }
00659       result_iter = result_iter->next;
00660     }
00661 
00662   return kb;
00663 }
00664 
00668 static void
00669 attack_host (struct arglist *globals, struct arglist *hostinfos, char *hostname,
00670              plugins_scheduler_t sched)
00671 {
00672   /* Used for the status */
00673   int num_plugs = 0;
00674   int cur_plug = 1;
00675 
00676   kb_t kb;
00677   gboolean new_kb = FALSE;
00678   int forks_retry = 0;
00679   struct arglist *plugins = arg_get_value (globals, "plugins");
00680   struct arglist *tmp;
00681 
00682   proctitle_set ("openvassd: testing %s", arg_get_value (hostinfos, "NAME"));
00683 
00684   kb = init_host_kb (globals, hostname, hostinfos, &new_kb);
00685 
00686   num_plugs = get_active_plugins_number (plugins);
00687 
00688   tmp = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00689   arg_add_value (tmp, "HOSTNAME", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, hostinfos);
00690 
00691   /* launch the plugins */
00692   pluginlaunch_init (globals);
00693 
00694   for (;;)
00695     {
00696       struct scheduler_plugin *plugin;
00697       pid_t parent;
00698 
00699       /* Check that our father is still alive */
00700       parent = getppid ();
00701       if (parent <= 1 || process_alive (parent) == 0)
00702         {
00703           pluginlaunch_stop ();
00704           return;
00705         }
00706 
00707       /* Idle if the scan has been paused. */
00708       if (pause_whole_test)
00709         {
00710           /* Let the running NVTs complete. */
00711           pluginlaunch_wait ();
00712 
00713           /* Send the PAUSE status to the client. */
00714           if (comm_send_status (globals, hostname, "pause", cur_plug, num_plugs)
00715               < 0)
00716             {
00717               pluginlaunch_stop ();
00718               goto host_died;
00719             }
00720 
00721           /* Wait for resume. */
00722           while (pause_whole_test)
00723             sleep (1);
00724 
00725           /* Send the RESUME status to the client. */
00726           if (comm_send_status (globals, hostname, "resume", cur_plug,
00727                                 num_plugs) < 0)
00728             {
00729               pluginlaunch_stop ();
00730               goto host_died;
00731             }
00732         }
00733 
00734       plugin = plugins_scheduler_next (sched);
00735       if (plugin != NULL && plugin != PLUG_RUNNING)
00736         {
00737           int e;
00738 
00739         again:
00740           e = launch_plugin (globals, sched, plugin, hostname, &cur_plug,
00741                              num_plugs, hostinfos, kb, new_kb);
00742           if (e < 0)
00743             {
00744               /*
00745                * Remote host died
00746                */
00747               if (e == ERR_HOST_DEAD)
00748                 goto host_died;
00749               else if (e == ERR_CANT_FORK)
00750                 {
00751                   if (forks_retry < MAX_FORK_RETRIES)
00752                     {
00753                       forks_retry++;
00754                       log_write ("fork() failed - sleeping %d seconds (%s)",
00755                                  forks_retry, strerror (errno));
00756                       fork_sleep (forks_retry);
00757                       goto again;
00758                     }
00759                   else
00760                     {
00761                       log_write ("fork() failed too many times - aborting");
00762                       goto host_died;
00763                     }
00764                 }
00765             }
00766         }
00767       else if (plugin == NULL)
00768         break;
00769       else
00770         pluginlaunch_wait_for_free_process ();
00771     }
00772 
00773   pluginlaunch_wait ();
00774 
00775 host_died:
00776   comm_send_status (globals, hostname, "attack", num_plugs, num_plugs);
00777   arg_free (tmp);
00778   pluginlaunch_stop ();
00779   plugins_scheduler_free (sched);
00780 
00781   gchar *network_scan_status = arg_get_value (globals, "network_scan_status");
00782   if (network_scan_status != NULL)
00783     {
00784       if (g_ascii_strcasecmp (network_scan_status, "busy") == 0)
00785         {
00786           save_kb_close (globals, "network");
00787         }
00788     }
00789   else
00790     if (new_kb == TRUE)
00791       save_kb_close (globals, hostname);
00792 
00793 }
00794 
00798 static void
00799 attack_start (struct attack_start_args *args)
00800 {
00801   struct arglist *globals = args->globals;
00802   char host_str[1024];
00803   char *mac = args->host_mac_addr;
00804   struct arglist *plugs = arg_get_value (globals, "plugins");
00805   struct in6_addr *hostip = &(args->hostip);
00806   struct arglist *hostinfos;
00807 
00808   struct arglist *preferences = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00809   char *non_simult = arg_get_value (preferences, "non_simult_ports");
00810   char *vhosts = arg_get_value (preferences, "vhosts");
00811   char *vhosts_ip = arg_get_value (preferences, "vhosts_ip");
00812   int thread_socket = args->thread_socket;
00813   int soc;
00814   struct timeval then, now;
00815   plugins_scheduler_t sched = args->sched;
00816   int i;
00817 
00818   /* Stringify the IP address. */
00819   if (IN6_IS_ADDR_V4MAPPED (&args->hostip))
00820     inet_ntop (AF_INET, ((char *)(&args->hostip))+12, host_str,
00821                sizeof (host_str));
00822   else
00823     inet_ntop (AF_INET6, &args->hostip, host_str,
00824                sizeof (host_str));
00825 
00826 
00827   openvas_signal (SIGUSR1, attack_handle_sigusr1);
00828   openvas_signal (SIGUSR2, attack_handle_sigusr2);
00829 
00830   thread_socket = dup2 (thread_socket, 4);
00831 
00832   /* Close all file descriptors >= 6 */
00833   for (i = 6; i < getdtablesize (); i++)
00834     close (i);
00835 
00836   gettimeofday (&then, NULL);
00837 
00838   if (non_simult == NULL)
00839     {
00840       non_simult = estrdup ("139, 445");
00841       arg_add_value (preferences, "non_simult_ports", ARG_STRING,
00842                      strlen (non_simult), non_simult);
00843     }
00844   arg_add_value (preferences, "non_simult_ports_list", ARG_ARGLIST, -1,
00845                  (void *) list2arglist (non_simult));
00846 
00847   /* Options regarding the communication with our parent */
00848   openvas_deregister_connection (GPOINTER_TO_SIZE
00849                                  (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket")));
00850   arg_set_value (globals, "global_socket", -1,
00851                  GSIZE_TO_POINTER (thread_socket));
00852 
00853   /* Wait for the server to confirm it read our data (prevents client desynch) */
00854   arg_add_value (globals, "confirm", ARG_INT, sizeof (int), (void *) 1);
00855 
00856   soc = thread_socket;
00857   if (vhosts == NULL || vhosts_ip == NULL)
00858     hostinfos = attack_init_hostinfos (mac, host_str, hostip, args->fqdn);
00859   else
00860     {
00861       char *txt_ip;
00862       struct in_addr inaddr;
00863       inaddr.s_addr = hostip->s6_addr32[3];
00864 
00865       if (IN6_IS_ADDR_V4MAPPED (hostip))
00866         txt_ip = estrdup (inet_ntoa (inaddr));
00867       else
00868         {
00869           char name[512];
00870           txt_ip = estrdup (inet_ntop (AF_INET6, hostip, name, sizeof (name)));
00871         }
00872       if (strcmp (vhosts_ip, txt_ip) != 0)
00873         vhosts = NULL;
00874       hostinfos = attack_init_hostinfos_vhosts (mac, host_str, hostip, vhosts,
00875                                                 args->fqdn);
00876     }
00877 
00878   if (mac)
00879     strcpy (host_str, mac);
00880 
00881   plugins_set_socket (plugs, soc);
00882   ntp_timestamp_host_scan_starts (globals, host_str);
00883 
00884   // Start scan
00885   attack_host (globals, hostinfos, host_str, sched);
00886 
00887   // Calculate duration, clean up
00888   ntp_timestamp_host_scan_ends (globals, host_str);
00889   gettimeofday (&now, NULL);
00890   if (now.tv_usec < then.tv_usec)
00891     {
00892       then.tv_sec++;
00893       now.tv_usec += 1000000;
00894     }
00895 
00896   log_write ("Finished testing %s. Time : %ld.%.2ld secs\n", host_str,
00897              (long) (now.tv_sec - then.tv_sec),
00898              (long) ((now.tv_usec - then.tv_usec) / 10000));
00899   shutdown (soc, 2);
00900   close (soc);
00901 }
00902 
00914 gboolean
00915 free_uploaded_file (gchar * key, gchar * value, gpointer ignored)
00916 {
00917   return TRUE;
00918 }
00919 
00920 /*******************************************************
00921 
00922     PUBLIC FUNCTIONS
00923 
00924 ********************************************************/
00925 
00926 static void
00927 apply_hosts_preferences (openvas_hosts_t *hosts, struct arglist *preferences)
00928 {
00929   char *ordering, *exclude_hosts;
00930 
00931   if (hosts == NULL || preferences == NULL)
00932     return;
00933 
00934   /* Hosts ordering strategy: sequential, random, reversed... */
00935   ordering = preferences_get_string (preferences, "hosts_ordering");
00936   if (ordering)
00937     {
00938       if (!strcmp (ordering, "random"))
00939         {
00940           openvas_hosts_shuffle (hosts);
00941           log_write ("hosts_ordering: Random.\n");
00942         }
00943       else if (!strcmp (ordering, "reverse"))
00944         {
00945           openvas_hosts_reverse (hosts);
00946           log_write ("hosts_ordering: Reverse.\n");
00947         }
00948     }
00949   else
00950     log_write ("hosts_ordering: Sequential.\n");
00951 
00952   /* Exclude hosts ? */
00953   exclude_hosts = preferences_get_string (preferences, "exclude_hosts");
00954   if (exclude_hosts)
00955     {
00956       /* Exclude hosts, resolving hostnames. */
00957       int ret = openvas_hosts_exclude (hosts, exclude_hosts, 1);
00958 
00959       if (ret >= 0)
00960         log_write ("exclude_hosts: Skipped %d host(s).\n", ret);
00961       else
00962         log_write ("exclude_hosts: Error.\n");
00963     }
00964 
00965   /* Reverse-lookup unify ? */
00966   if (preferences_get_bool (preferences, "reverse_lookup_unify") == 1)
00967     log_write ("reverse_lookup_unify: Skipped %d host(s).\n",
00968                openvas_hosts_reverse_lookup_unify (hosts));
00969 
00970   /* Hosts that reverse-lookup only ? */
00971   if (preferences_get_bool (preferences, "reverse_lookup_only") == 1)
00972     log_write ("reverse_lookup_only: Skipped %d host(s).\n",
00973                openvas_hosts_reverse_lookup_only (hosts));
00974 }
00975 
00976 static void
00977 error_message_to_client (struct arglist *globals, const char *msg,
00978                          const char *hostname, const char *port)
00979 {
00980   auth_printf (globals,
00981                "SERVER <|> ERRMSG <|> %s <|> %s <|> %s <|>  <|> SERVER\n",
00982                hostname ? hostname : "",
00983                port ? port : "",
00984                msg ? msg : "No error.");
00985 }
00986 
00987 static int
00988 str_in_comma_list (const char *str, const char *comma_list)
00989 {
00990   gchar **element, **split;
00991 
00992   if (str == NULL || comma_list == NULL)
00993     return 0;
00994 
00995   split = g_strsplit (comma_list, ",", 0);
00996   element = split;
00997   while (*element)
00998     {
00999       gchar *stripped = g_strstrip (*element);
01000 
01001       if (stripped && strcmp (stripped, str) == 0)
01002         {
01003           g_strfreev (split);
01004           return 1;
01005         }
01006 
01007       element++;
01008     }
01009 
01010   g_strfreev (split);
01011   return 0;
01012 }
01013 
01014 /*
01015  * Checks if a network interface is authorized to be used as source interface.
01016  *
01017  * @return 0 if iface is NULL, -1 if unauthorized by ifaces_deny/ifaces_allow,
01018  * -2 if by sys_ifaces_deny/sys_ifaces_allow, 1 otherwise.
01019  */
01020 static int
01021 iface_authorized (const char *iface, struct arglist *preferences)
01022 {
01023   const char *ifaces_list;
01024 
01025   if (iface == NULL)
01026     return 0;
01027 
01028   ifaces_list = preferences_get_string (preferences, "ifaces_deny");
01029   if (ifaces_list && str_in_comma_list (iface, ifaces_list))
01030     return -1;
01031   ifaces_list = preferences_get_string (preferences, "ifaces_allow");
01032   if (ifaces_list && !str_in_comma_list (iface, ifaces_list))
01033     return -1;
01034   /* sys_* preferences are similar, but can't be overriden by the client. */
01035   ifaces_list = preferences_get_string (preferences, "sys_ifaces_deny");
01036   if (ifaces_list && str_in_comma_list (iface, ifaces_list))
01037     return -2;
01038   ifaces_list = preferences_get_string (preferences, "sys_ifaces_allow");
01039   if (ifaces_list && !str_in_comma_list (iface, ifaces_list))
01040     return -2;
01041 
01042   return 1;
01043 }
01044 
01045 /*
01046  * Checks if a host is authorized to be scanned.
01047  *
01048  * @param[in]   host    Host to check access to.
01049  * @param[in]   addr    Pointer to address so a hostname isn't resolved multiple
01050  *                      times.
01051  * @param[in]   hosts_allow   Hosts whitelist.
01052  * @param[in]   hosts_deny    Hosts blacklist.
01053  *
01054  * @return 1 if host authorized, 0 otherwise.
01055  */
01056 static int
01057 host_authorized (const openvas_host_t *host, const struct in6_addr *addr,
01058                  const openvas_hosts_t *hosts_allow,
01059                  const openvas_hosts_t *hosts_deny)
01060 {
01061   /* Check Hosts Access. */
01062   if (host == NULL)
01063     return 0;
01064 
01065   if (hosts_deny && openvas_host_in_hosts (host, addr, hosts_deny))
01066     return 0;
01067   if (hosts_allow && !openvas_host_in_hosts (host, addr, hosts_allow))
01068     return 0;
01069 
01070   return 1;
01071 }
01072 
01073 /*
01074  * Applies the source_iface scanner preference, if allowed by ifaces_allow and
01075  * ifaces_deny preferences.
01076  *
01077  * @return 0 if source_iface preference applied or not found, -1 if
01078  * unauthorized value, -2 if iface can't be used.
01079  */
01080 static int
01081 apply_source_iface_preference (struct arglist *globals,
01082                                struct arglist *preferences)
01083 {
01084   char *source_iface;
01085   int ret;
01086 
01087   source_iface = preferences_get_string (preferences, "source_iface");
01088   if (source_iface == NULL)
01089     return 0;
01090 
01091   ret = iface_authorized (source_iface, preferences);
01092   if (ret == -1)
01093     {
01094       gchar *msg = g_strdup_printf ("Unauthorized source interface: %s",
01095                                     source_iface);
01096       log_write ("source_iface: Unauthorized source interface %s.\n",
01097                  source_iface);
01098       error_message_to_client (globals, msg, NULL, NULL);
01099 
01100       g_free (msg);
01101       return -1;
01102     }
01103   else if (ret == -2)
01104     {
01105       gchar *msg = g_strdup_printf ("Unauthorized source interface: %s"
01106                                     " (system-wide restriction.)",
01107                                     source_iface);
01108       log_write ("source_iface: Unauthorized source interface %s."
01109                  " (sys_* preference restriction.)\n",
01110                  source_iface);
01111       error_message_to_client (globals, msg, NULL, NULL);
01112 
01113       g_free (msg);
01114       return -1;
01115     }
01116 
01117   if (openvas_source_iface_init (source_iface))
01118     {
01119       gchar *msg = g_strdup_printf ("Erroneous source interface: %s",
01120                                     source_iface);
01121       log_write ("source_iface: Error with %s interface.\n", source_iface);
01122       error_message_to_client (globals, msg, NULL, NULL);
01123 
01124       g_free (msg);
01125       return -2;
01126     }
01127   else
01128     {
01129       char *ipstr, *ip6str;
01130       ipstr = openvas_source_addr_str ();
01131       ip6str = openvas_source_addr6_str ();
01132       log_write ("source_iface: Using %s (%s / %s).\n", source_iface,
01133                  ipstr, ip6str);
01134 
01135       g_free (ipstr);
01136       g_free (ip6str);
01137       return 0;
01138     }
01139 }
01140 
01144 void
01145 attack_network (struct arglist *globals)
01146 {
01147   int max_hosts = 0, max_checks;
01148   int num_tested = 0;
01149   char *hostlist;
01150   openvas_hosts_t *hosts, *hosts_allow, *hosts_deny;
01151   openvas_hosts_t *sys_hosts_allow, *sys_hosts_deny;
01152   openvas_host_t *host;
01153   int global_socket = -1;
01154   struct arglist *preferences = NULL;
01155   struct arglist *plugins = NULL;
01156   plugins_scheduler_t sched;
01157   int fork_retries = 0;
01158   GHashTable *files;
01159   struct timeval then, now;
01160   char buffer[INET6_ADDRSTRLEN];
01161 
01162   int network_phase = 0;
01163   gchar *network_targets, *port_range;
01164   int do_network_scan = 0;
01165   int scan_stopped;
01166 
01167   gettimeofday (&then, NULL);
01168 
01169   preferences = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
01170 
01171   if ((do_network_scan = preferences_get_bool (preferences, "network_scan")) == -1)
01172     do_network_scan = 0;
01173   network_targets = arg_get_value (preferences, "network_targets");
01174   if (network_targets != NULL)
01175     arg_add_value (globals, "network_targets", ARG_STRING,
01176                    strlen (network_targets), network_targets);
01177   if (do_network_scan)
01178     {
01179       gchar *network_scan_status = arg_get_value (globals, "network_scan_status");
01180       if (network_scan_status != NULL)
01181         if (g_ascii_strcasecmp (network_scan_status, "done") == 0)
01182           network_phase = 0;
01183         else
01184           network_phase = 1;
01185       else
01186         {
01187           arg_add_value (globals, "network_scan_status", ARG_STRING,
01188                          strlen ("busy"), "busy");
01189           network_phase = 1;
01190         }
01191     }
01192 
01193   num_tested = 0;
01194 
01195   global_socket = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket"));
01196 
01197   plugins = arg_get_value (globals, "plugins");
01198 
01199   /* Init and check Target List */
01200   hostlist = arg_get_value (preferences, "TARGET");
01201   if (hostlist == NULL)
01202     {
01203       error_message_to_client (globals, "Missing target hosts", NULL, NULL);
01204       return;
01205     }
01206 
01207   /* Verify the port range is a valid one */
01208   port_range = arg_get_value (preferences, "port_range");
01209   if (validate_port_range (port_range))
01210     {
01211       error_message_to_client (globals, "Invalid port range", NULL, port_range);
01212       return;
01213     }
01214 
01215   /* Initialize the attack. */
01216   sched = plugins_scheduler_init (plugins,
01217     preferences_get_bool (preferences, "auto_enable_dependencies") == 1 ? 1 : 0,
01218     network_phase);
01219 
01220   max_hosts = get_max_hosts_number (preferences);
01221   max_checks = get_max_checks_number (preferences);
01222 
01223   if (network_phase)
01224     {
01225       network_targets = arg_get_value (preferences, "network_targets");
01226       if (network_targets == NULL)
01227         {
01228           log_write ("WARNING: In network phase, but without targets! Stopping.\n");
01229           host = NULL;
01230         }
01231       else
01232         {
01233           log_write
01234             ("Start a new scan. Target(s) : %s, in network phase with target %s\n",
01235              hostlist, network_targets);
01236         }
01237     }
01238   else
01239     {
01240       log_write ("Starts a new scan. Target(s) : %s, with max_hosts = %d and"
01241                  " max_checks = %d\n", hostlist, max_hosts, max_checks);
01242     }
01243 
01244   hosts = openvas_hosts_new (hostlist);
01245   /* Apply Hosts preferences. */
01246   apply_hosts_preferences (hosts, preferences);
01247 
01248   /* Don't start if the provided interface is unauthorized. */
01249   if (apply_source_iface_preference (globals, preferences) != 0)
01250     {
01251       openvas_hosts_free (hosts);
01252       error_message_to_client (globals, "Interface not authorized for scanning", NULL, NULL);
01253       return;
01254     }
01255   /* hosts_allow/deny lists. */
01256   hosts_allow = openvas_hosts_new (preferences_get_string
01257                                     (preferences, "hosts_allow"));
01258   hosts_deny = openvas_hosts_new (preferences_get_string
01259                                    (preferences, "hosts_deny"));
01260   /* sys_* preferences, which can't be overriden by the client. */
01261   sys_hosts_allow = openvas_hosts_new (preferences_get_string
01262                                         (preferences, "sys_hosts_allow"));
01263   sys_hosts_deny = openvas_hosts_new (preferences_get_string
01264                                        (preferences, "sys_hosts_deny"));
01265   host = openvas_hosts_next (hosts);
01266   if (host == NULL)
01267     goto stop;
01268   hosts_init (global_socket, max_hosts);
01269   /*
01270    * Start the attack !
01271    */
01272   while (host)
01273     {
01274       int pid;
01275       char *hostname;
01276       struct in6_addr host_ip;
01277 
01278       hostname = openvas_host_value_str (host);
01279       if (openvas_host_get_addr6 (host, &host_ip) == -1)
01280         {
01281           log_write ("Couldn't resolve target %s\n", hostname);
01282           error_message_to_client (globals, "Couldn't resolve hostname.",
01283                                    hostname, NULL);
01284           g_free (hostname);
01285           host = openvas_hosts_next (hosts);
01286           continue;
01287         }
01288 
01289       /* Do we have the right to test this host ? */
01290       if (!host_authorized (host, &host_ip, hosts_allow, hosts_deny))
01291         {
01292           error_message_to_client (globals, "Host access denied.",
01293                                    hostname, NULL);
01294           log_write ("Host %s access denied.", hostname);
01295         }
01296       else if (!host_authorized (host, &host_ip, sys_hosts_allow,
01297                                  sys_hosts_deny))
01298         {
01299           error_message_to_client (globals, "Host access denied"
01300                                             " (system-wide restriction.)",
01301                                    hostname, NULL);
01302           log_write ("Host %s access denied (sys_* preference restriction.)",
01303                      hostname);
01304         }
01305       else
01306         {
01307           struct attack_start_args args;
01308           int s;
01309           char *MAC = NULL;
01310           int mac_err = -1;
01311           gchar *name;
01312 
01313           if (preferences_get_bool (preferences, "use_mac_addr") > 0
01314               && v6_is_local_ip (&host_ip))
01315             {
01316               mac_err = v6_get_mac_addr (&host_ip, &MAC);
01317               if (mac_err > 0)
01318                 {
01319                   /* remote host is down */
01320                   g_free (hostname);
01321                   host = openvas_hosts_next (hosts);
01322                   continue;
01323                 }
01324             }
01325 
01326           s = hosts_new (globals, hostname);
01327           if (s < 0)
01328             goto scan_stop;
01329 
01330           args.globals = globals;
01331           memcpy (&args.hostip, &host_ip, sizeof (struct in6_addr));
01332           name = openvas_host_value_str (host);
01333           strncpy (args.fqdn, name, sizeof (args.fqdn));
01334           g_free (name);
01335           args.host_mac_addr = MAC;
01336           args.sched = sched;
01337           args.thread_socket = s;
01338 
01339         forkagain:
01340           pid = create_process ((process_func_t) attack_start, &args);
01341           if (pid < 0)
01342             {
01343               fork_retries++;
01344               if (fork_retries > MAX_FORK_RETRIES)
01345                 {
01346                   /* Forking failed - we go to the wait queue. */
01347                   log_write ("fork() failed - %s. %s won't be tested\n",
01348                              strerror (errno), hostname);
01349                   efree (&MAC);
01350                   goto stop;
01351                 }
01352 
01353               log_write
01354                 ("fork() failed - sleeping %d seconds and trying again...\n",
01355                  fork_retries);
01356               fork_sleep (fork_retries);
01357               goto forkagain;
01358             }
01359 
01360           hosts_set_pid (hostname, pid);
01361           if (network_phase)
01362             log_write ("Testing %s (network level) [%d]\n",
01363                        network_targets, pid);
01364           else
01365             log_write ("Testing %s (%s) [%d]\n",
01366                        hostname, inet_ntop (AF_INET6,
01367                                             &args.hostip,
01368                                             buffer,
01369                                             sizeof (buffer)),
01370                        pid);
01371           if (MAC != NULL)
01372             efree (&MAC);
01373         }
01374 
01375       num_tested++;
01376 
01377       if (network_phase)
01378         {
01379           host = NULL;
01380           arg_set_value (globals, "network_scan_status", strlen ("done"), "done");
01381         }
01382       else
01383         {
01384           g_free (hostname);
01385           host = openvas_hosts_next (hosts);
01386         }
01387     }
01388 
01389   /* Every host is being tested... We have to wait for the processes
01390    * to terminate. */
01391   while (hosts_read (globals) == 0)
01392     ;
01393 
01394   log_write ("Test complete");
01395 
01396 scan_stop:
01397   /* Free the memory used by the files uploaded by the user, if any. */
01398   files = arg_get_value (globals, "files_translation");
01399   if (files)
01400     g_hash_table_foreach_remove (files, (GHRFunc) free_uploaded_file, NULL);
01401 
01402 stop:
01403   scan_stopped = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE(arg_get_value (globals, "stop_required"));
01404 
01405   openvas_hosts_free (hosts);
01406   openvas_hosts_free (hosts_allow);
01407   openvas_hosts_free (hosts_deny);
01408   openvas_hosts_free (sys_hosts_allow);
01409   openvas_hosts_free (sys_hosts_deny);
01410 
01411   plugins_scheduler_free (sched);
01412 
01413   gettimeofday (&now, NULL);
01414   log_write ("Total time to scan all hosts : %ld seconds\n",
01415              now.tv_sec - then.tv_sec);
01416 
01417   if (do_network_scan && network_phase && !scan_stopped)
01418     attack_network (globals);
01419 
01420   return;
01421 }
Generated on 23 Oct 2015 for OpenVAS Scanner by  1.6.1
